# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code for your problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    result = ""
    line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) <= text_width
            if isempty(line)
                line = word
            else
                line *= " " * word
            end
        else
            result *= "\n" * line
            line = word
        end
    end

    return result * "\n" * line  # Add the last line if it was not added in the loop.
end
```

You can use this function like so:

```julia
println(wrap_string("This is a test string to check wrapping functionality", 15))
```

In this example, the text "This is a test string to check wrapping functionality" would be split into lines with maximum width of 15 characters. The output will look like:

```julia
This is a test
string to check
wrapping
functionality
```
